newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Sasol says not withdrawing from fuel market.
newsitem.headline: Sasol says not withdrawing from fuel market.

text.p: Sasol Ltd said on Monday that it had no intention of withdrawing from the fuels and lubricants markets and was currently looking into establishing a retail service station network.
The statement was made in response to newspaper reports which gave competing oil and fuels firm Engen Ltd's perceptions of Sasol's strategy and future plans.
"Recent reports in the print media gave the impression that there is uncertainty about Sasol's future plans regarding the marketing of fuels and lubricants. This is not correct.
"Sasol is surprised that a company (Engen) in the oil industry announced to the media their perceptions of Sasol's strategy and plans for the future," the statement said.
Sasol said it had repeatedly stated its intention to fully integrate its crude oil refining activities, from exploration to retail marketing.
This, it said, could be achieved through Sasol Oil, the subsidiary in the Sasol Group which is responsible for the refining of crude oil at the Natref refinery.
"Since Sasol does not presently market its fuels and lubricants through a fully fledged retail service station network, the establishment of such a network is presently being addressed."
